p: The results of GC-MS-FID analyses of the essential oils obtained from the leaves of female and male specimens of carquejas and from the two commercial samples from São Paulo and Paraná states are displayed in Table 1. According to the literature, sesquiterpenoids and monoterpenoids are the predominant compounds in Baccharis genus essential oils [ 15, 19, 21]. In general, it was observed that the samples with the highest concentrations of oxygenated monoterpenes and oxygenated sesquiterpenes were collected in Paraná (PRMV and PRFV) and São Paulo (SPFV and SPM) states, respectively. Interestingly, the commercial sample PRCoV exhibited higher amounts of oxygenated monoterpenes compared to SPCoV.
